definitions.text: process or result of distributing or extending over a wide expanse of space
a conspicuous disparity or difference as between two figures
examples: the spread between lending and borrowing costs

definitions.text: farm consisting of a large tract of land along with facilities needed to raise livestock (especially cattle)
a haphazard distribution in all directions
a tasty mixture to be spread on bread or crackers or used in preparing other dishes
a meal that is well prepared and greatly enjoyed
examples: a banquet for the graduating seniors
they put out quite a spread

definitions.text: two facing pages of a book or other publication
the expansion of a person's girth (especially at middle age)
examples: she exercised to avoid that middle-aged spread

definitions.text: decorative cover for a bed
act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time
distribute or disperse widely
examples: The invaders spread their language all over the country

definitions.text: become distributed or widespread
spread across or over
examples: A big oil spot spread across the water

definitions.text: spread out or open from a closed or folded state
cause to become widely known
become widely known and passed on
examples: the story went around in the office

definitions.text: strew or distribute over an area
examples: He spread fertilizer over the lawn

definitions.text: move outward
cover by spreading something over
distribute over a surface in a layer
examples: spread cheese on a piece of bread

definitions.text: distributed or spread over a considerable extent
examples: has ties with many widely dispersed friends
eleven million Jews are spread throughout Europe

definitions.text: prepared or arranged for a meal; especially having food set out
fully extended in width
